titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Logbook of the Schooner Don Nicholas, 1846-1847 MS 572

publicationstmt.publisher: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

note.p: Stored on-site at the Woodson Research Center.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-04-01 23:12:33 -0500.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.corpname: Woodson Research Center, Rice University, Houston, Texas

did.unittitle: Logbook of the Schooner Don Nicholas
did.abstract: The log reveals the ship's travel from port to port, touching at Calais; Baltimore; Portland; Santiago, Cuba; New York; among others. Its varied cargo included bushels of corn, molasses, sugar, tobacco, etc.

bioghist.head: Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The schooner Don Nicholas was engaged in trade between Europe and the Americas. This portion of the ships log, Schooner Don Nicholas, from Calais for Baltimore, Rowland York, Master, begins in mid-sea and contains day-to-day reports of the ship's position, weather, and events on board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The log reveals the ship's travel from port to port, touching at Calais; Baltimore; Portland; Santiago, Cuba; New York; among others. Its varied cargo included bushels of corn, molasses, sugar, tobacco, etc.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This material is open for research.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Stored on-site at the Woodson Research Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Schooner Don Nicholas Logbook, MS 572, Woodson Research Center, Fondren Library, Rice University
